item.title: Using different configuration per stage
item.description: In the previous article we saw how to create a basic deployment pipeline for a serverless application. In this article, we’re going to enrich the deployment by allowing to have different values for configuration settings in each stage. Background The moment your application starts to be a little bit more complex, you need to use configuration settings. These settings can be things like the log level, addresses of external services, usernames and (encrypted) passwords, etc.

item.title: Deploying a serverless application
item.description: Starting with AWS Lambda is really easy. You can even write a function in the browser! But that’s not how you should work on a daily basis. You must have a CI/CD pipeline set up, you probably have two accounts (one for production and another one for development), you need a repeatable and reliable way to create your infrastructure and so on. In this article I’ll show you how to create a simple continuous delivery pipeline that brings us closer to a professional application development.
